title: Create allow list for Safe Browsing
content:
Dear Support

I'm trying to launch a phishing awareness campaign in my company. The phishing awareness webpage needs to resemble an actual phishing page to see which users would enter their credentials.

Both Google Chrome and FireFox are protected by Google Safe Browsing which (correctly) flags the webpage as phishing. I'm aware that sites which are incorrectly flagged could be appealed, but the site is meant to masquerade as a phishing website.

That's why I would like to create an exception for the company users to be able to access this specific webpage without the red screen warning the user.

On Google Chrome, I was able to download the GPO and edit the allow list for safe browsing: GPO: https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/187202?hl=en#zippy=%2Cwindows GPO Safe Browsing setting: https://admx.help/?Category=Chrome&Policy=Google.Policies.Chrome::SafeBrowsingAllowlistDomains

I tried to do the same thing for Firefox: GPO: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/customizing-firefox-using-group-policy-windows

I downloaded the Policy template for Firefox 96 (template v3.5) but I couldn't find an option to configure an allow list for safe browsing. I don't want to weaken the overall security by disabling safe browsing altogether.

Are there any other options I could take, or is there simply no way to configure safe browsing settings for Firefox?

Best Regards Andrea
